programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: In 1966, two Ohio police officers spot a strange light in the sky, triggering a chase across state lines. An ex-military man in Florida is knocked out by a beam of light in 1965.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: T Money and Papa Bear battle over bins while Brandon and Lori play different kinds of games.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bidders go head to head on a bin full of motorcycle parts, a unit with a body bag and hooks hanging from the ceiling has everyone dying to know what's inside.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Join antiques expert and presenter David Dickinson as more collectors try to sell their items to dealers. Will they strike a deal or take a chance at auction instead.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Discover terrifying new images of a blob swallowing a city, spy ships attacking America, skydiving cannibal spiders and the radioactive killer fly factory.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Look inside America's top-secret apocalypse pyramid, explore China's hidden terror camps and see Iran's hidden terror-crater.

programme.title: Proof Is Out There: Military Mysteries
programme.desc: Analysing if a Korean soldier captured during D-Day fighting for the Nazis was the most captured person in the history of war.

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: Sin City thriller with Jason Statham. A compulsive gambler who does favours for money just wants out of the Vegas life. Just one big win at the tables should do it..

programme.title: Glass
programme.desc: M. Night Shyamalan directs an all-star cast in this genre-bending superhero sequel. Three superhumans team up to escape a psychiatric ward. With Bruce Willis in a cagoule.

programme.title: Benjamin
programme.desc: Simon Amstell's bittersweet comedy romance stars Colin Morgan as a young filmmaker angsting over his second feature when he falls for a French music student.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Sign2Win
programme.desc: Relationships are put to test as colleagues, sisters, and a married couple battle it out for £1,000. Will their nerves hold up under the pressure of these five games.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: Anthony Asquith's drama based on a famous 1912 court case with Cedric Hardwicke as the father of a boy accused of theft who pursues the case to the highest courts. With Robert Donat.

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: Drama. Spencer Tracy stars as an unfairly unpopular priest living on a volcanic South Sea island which is about to erupt. With Kerwin Matthews, Frank Sinatra and Barbara Luna.

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: Roland Emmerich's sprawling, action-packed war drama about the Battle of Midway, a major turning point in World War II. Starring Ed Skrein, Luke Evans and Woody Harrelson.

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: Sci-fi action. Mark Wahlberg discovers that his hallucinations are memories from past lives. There are others like him, but they don't all have good intentions..

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: Outrageous satirical comedy from the South Park team. A crack team of puppets battle to save the world from an evil terrorist plot hatched by North Korean leader Kim Jong Il.

programme.title: Antwone Fisher
programme.desc: Real-life drama with Denzel Washington. In trying to uncover the reason for recruit Antwone Fisher's violence, a naval psychiatrist uncovers a history of child abuse.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: Drama with John Ireland. A local politician begins to lust for the kind of power he used to hold to account. He should be careful how he treats people on the way to the top..

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: Poignant Ealing drama starring seven-year-old Mandy Miller as a deaf girl whose parents - played by Phyllis Calvert and Terence Morgan - fight over her treatment.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: Cowboys & Aliens
programme.desc: Sci-fi western starring Daniel Craig and Harrison Ford. A brutal cattle baron and his amnesiac enemy must cease their feuding when a town is attacked by aliens.

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: Drama starring Emma Thompson as a recently widowed, retired teacher who has a sexual bucket list she wants to get around to now that she has the time and, perhaps, even the energy.

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: Adults only horror with Daisy Edgar-Jones. When date-weary Noa meets a guy in a supermarket, she thinks things are looking up. But he's oddly obsessed with not eating animals..

programme.title: The Riot Club
programme.desc: Dark drama about the members of an elite Oxford University drinking society. Starring Sam Claflin, Max Irons and Holliday Grainger. Sex/very strong language/drugs/violence.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Classic western with Glenn Ford and Van Heflin. The capture of a murderous stagecoach robber propels an impoverished local rancher on a perilous journey. Directed by Delmer Daves.

programme.title: The Man from Colorado
programme.desc: Western. When a sadistic Union colonel (Glenn Ford) becomes a federal judge after the Civil War, his friend (William Holden) takes the deputy job to try and temper his actions.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the thriller series.

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: This dark comedy from Ealing studios sees Alec Guinness take on the roles of eight characters, all the noble victims of a vengeance-seeking relative, played by Dennis Price.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet star in James Cameron's Oscar-winning epic. Lovers from across the social divide meet on the doomed luxury liner.

programme.title: The Contractor
programme.desc: Action thriller with Chris Pine. An ex-soldier takes on private work to feed his family, but finds himself in dire straits (danger; not the band). With Kiefer Sutherland.

programme.title: How to Blow Up a Pipeline
programme.desc: High-octane eco-thriller. A disparate group of young Americans unite to disrupt the oil industry in an act motivated by everything from the ideological to the downright personal.

programme.desc: Walmart NW Arkansas Championship final-round play from Pinnacle CC in Rogers, Ark. Thailand's Jasmine Suwannapura (17-under-par) prevailed here last year after a playoff vs. American Lucy Li. Local favorite Stacy Lewis announced this week that this is her final LPGA season.

programme.desc: PURE Insurance Championship final-round play from famed Pebble Beach Golf Links and Spyglass Hill GC on California's Monterey Peninsula. England's Paul Broadhurst (14-under-par) prevailed last year by three shots over Alex Cejka.

programme.desc: Rear Admiral Frederick Burdett Warder was known for both his bravery and his humility. Warder was Skipper of the USS Seawolf submarine during WWII. A man who believed his enemy was also his brother, Warder ordered his crew to rescue enemy battle survivors from the sea even if they refused to come aboard. This documentary tells the story of Warder's remarkable life.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to - news and highlights, guests and interviews - but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.
